justification: “we employed the Working Alliance Inventory (WAI-SR) … to assess the quality of the therapeutic relationship between the client and the therapist.”
The authors state that the WAI-SR includes the subscale item 'I believe my therapist likes me' representing the emotional bond dimension.
WAI-SR is said to capture 'alignment regarding the prioritized treatment goals,' exemplified by the item 'My therapist and I agree on what is important for me to work on'.
The text notes that WAI-SR assesses 'consensus on the tasks integral to achieving these objectives,' e.g., 'I feel that the things I do in therapy will help me to accomplish the changes that I want.'
Clinicians 'were tasked to quantitatively rate the clinical performance of each chatbot using the Cognitive Therapy Scale Revised (CTSR) questionnaire.'
Within the CTSR, 'Assessment of Therapeutic Relation' is listed as a distinct dimension scored from 0 to 6.
The authors explain that CTSR 'evaluates the therapist's adeptness in maintaining session structure and managing time effectively.'
CTSR 'gauges the therapist's ability to develop and integrate appropriate conceptualizations within the therapy framework.'
CTSR 'evaluates the therapist's application of cognitive and behavioral methods to facilitate therapeutic change.'
